video.title: Learn CSS Media Queries by Building 3 Projects - Full Course
video.description:
Learn how to use CSS Media Queries, which are essential to creating websites responsive to different screen sizes. After learning the basics, you will learn how to use media queries to create three practical projects.

📄 Article version: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/learn-css-media-queries-by-building-projects/

✏️ This course was created by Joy Shaheb. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHG7IJuST_BXJkne-0u0Xtw

💻 GitHub Repository: https://github.com/JoyShaheb/Project-image-repo/tree/main/Media-Query-Project

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Intro
⌨️ (0:01:44) Setup
⌨️ (0:21:08) Project-1
⌨️ (0:21:10) @ media rule
⌨️ (0:22:35) And operator
⌨️ (0:24:06) Media Type
⌨️ (0:24:39) Max-Width
⌨️ (0:27:01) Min-Width
⌨️ (0:33:56) Project-2 Desktop
⌨️ (1:05:55) Project-2 Mobile
⌨️ (1:14:58) Project-3 Desktop
⌨️ (1:23:07) Project-3 Mobile
⌨️ (1:25:53) Conclusion

🎉 Thanks to our Champion supporters:
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster
👾 Katia Moran 

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

Great job and thank you!! (Sorry if my english isnt very good)

topLevelComment.author: Jimmy Ekisa

replies.author: Jimmy Ekisa
replies.text: @Joy Shaheb Thanks a lot. So, apparently, I had set my div using "class" instead of "id" in the index.html file, and so, I wasn't targeting the right id in the javascript code. All fine now. I can now carry on to the end, wish me luck!!!

replies.author: Joy Shaheb
Jimmy Ekisa
Joy Shaheb
replies.text:
You need to provoke the function 

At the bottom of javascript code, write this 

screen();

Thank me later 🌹

topLevelComment.author: johnnie gilkerson
topLevelComment.text: Hello. @15:52 in video, I am not getting red box around container, everything is just as you have instructed, maybe sass has to be downloaded? I have installed it from the vs code extensions, do you have any suggestions? Thanks

replies.author: Joy Shaheb
replies.text:
You guys have done everything right,  


Except, you didn't change it on your HTML.

Change on the line where you have linked the scss. 

Before 
Style.SCSS
After 
Style.CSS

Just remove 1 "S" it should work

replies.author: Hassan TAJIRI
replies.text: @Aviral hello Johnnie, did worked it out ? I'm facing the same pblm.

replies.author: Aviral
replies.text:
maybe because you did not compile it and in the html you linked to the scss file. If you installed the Live SASS compiler from the vscode extensions,then on the menu bar,on the bottom click on watch sass. it will generate a css file for you, in the html link it to the CSS file. Now if you code scss in your scss file,then it will automatically generate the css for it in the css file....

you don't have to install sass to code it in vscode,the extension is enough.. 
or maybe you did not use the selector properly

hope it helped :)
